<h2>Distinguishing Features</h2>

A rare species xxxx

<h2>Similar species</h2>

With its rounded, mostly undivided underleaf, this species could only be mistaken for C. integrispula, a larger species (~2.5 mm wide) that occurs in the same damp habitats. The distinction is microscopic: C. neesiana has underleaves with bases that run down the stem (&quot;decurrent&quot;) and stem cells that lack oil bodies, while C. integrispula has oil bodies in its stem cells and the underleaves are not decurrent.
